channel.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
channel.description: Hi. Well I can't run any server because it say's it can't find the main class Server file, but when I look at the file, the icon is like a little notepad page, and I look at the type, and It says JAVA. How can I get a server class file back? Or how can I make them into class files? Someone please help!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you’re getting errors that means it’s finding some of the files, it seems to be one folder off…

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:20, topic:355607”]That’s exactly what I was looking for

So Server.class and Engine.class are in the Class->Net->com->canownuaeasy->net->codec folder? If they are, try this run again:

@echo off
@title CarnageX Server: Run
cd ../class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594
pause[/code]

And tell me what this compiler does:
[code]@echo off
@title CarnageX Server: Compile
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../class/ ../java/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/*.java
pause[/code][/quote]

The run.bat file does the same error. And the compiler gives me 34 errors. But I encounted a strange error. On one of the errors, it points out this:

[code]symbol  : variable Server
location: class net.com.canownueasy.net.codec.RS2LoginProtocol
if <Server.bannedUsers[i] != null & username.equalsIgnoreCase<Server.bannedUsers[i]>> {

All of the errors have something to do with the RS2LoginProtocol.

Read full topic

@davidi2 wrote:

That’s exactly what I was looking for

So Server.class and Engine.class are in the Class->Net->com->canownuaeasy->net->codec folder? If they are, try this run again:

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Run cd ../class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594 pause

And tell me what this compiler does:

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Compile "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../class/ ../java/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/*.java pause

item.source: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:16, topic:355607”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=452161.msg3313499#msg3313499 date=1282148645]

David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.
[/quote]Did you not see the difference in the Compiler and Run batch files? They go to different directories…
I’ve explained it before, but a compiler can take ONE java file, and compile an entire packaged server. It’s a chain reaction, whatever classes that the one java file calls are compiled, and then the classes that that one called are compiled, until all of the files that your server uses are compiled.

Both of us are kinda just taking guesses since neither of us know what the package looks like or where Server class is.[/quote]Yes.

Kate, can you post a picture of an expanded tree version of your server folders?

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:355607”][quote author=,Kate link=topic=452161.msg3313506#msg3313506 date=1282148750]

David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.

The thing is aswell, exactly the same thing happened when I tried to run Berkyscape, and another 508. Also, how do I do this Packaging method? - I’m not sure how to create a class file.
[/quote]Wait, you got the ‘Cannot find class file’ error on all of them? Or a different one.
You don’t need to use the packaging method, it’s just an extra large compiler. My server is packaged and it’s a one line compiler. You create a class file by compiling.[/quote]

Yeah. Basically, on all the last 3 servers I’ve tried running since fidgiting with my 614, I can’t run them. Plus, the .class files in the class>net>bla bla forgot folder are like a class file icon, with a miniture Notepad icon. It’s as If the Engine and Server files are invisible.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:355607”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=452161.msg3313491#msg3313491 date=1282148473]
David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.
[/quote]Did you not see the difference in the Compiler and Run batch files? They go to different directories…
I’ve explained it before, but a compiler can take ONE java file, and compile an entire packaged server. It’s a chain reaction, whatever classes that the one java file calls are compiled, and then the classes that that one called are compiled, until all of the files that your server uses are compiled.[/quote]
Both of us are kinda just taking guesses since neither of us know what the package looks like or where Server class is.

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=",Kate, post:14, topic:355607"][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=452161.msg3313491#msg3313491 date=1282148473]
David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.
[/quote]

The thing is aswell, exactly the same thing happened when I tried to run Berkyscape, and another 508. Also, how do I do this Packaging method? - I’m not sure how to create a class file.[/quote]Wait, you got the ‘Cannot find class file’ error on all of them? Or a different one.
You don’t need to use the packaging method, it’s just an extra large compiler. My server is packaged and it’s a one line compiler. You create a class file by compiling.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

deathschaos9:

David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.

The thing is aswell, exactly the same thing happened when I tried to run Berkyscape, and another 508. Also, how do I do this Packaging method? - I’m not sure how to create a class file.

Check your directories. Does it go: class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/Server.class? (Make sure that server.class is in there)

This was the whole point of me making this thread- there is no .class file of Server.java

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=",Kate, post:11, topic:355607"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=452161.msg3313473#msg3313473 date=1282148149]

My run:

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Run cd ../class "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" net/com/canownueasy/Server 43594 pause

My compiler:

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Compile cd ../java "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../class/ ./net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/*.java pause

[/quote]You f’d up your Run. Try doing this:

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Run cd ../class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/ "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594 pause

Same error.[/quote]Then I gave the wrong directory, one moment please.

@echo off @title CarnageX Server: Run cd ../class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" Server 43594 pause

Check your directories. Does it go:
class/net/com/canownueasy/net/codec/Server.class? (Make sure that server.class is in there)

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:12, topic:355607”]David I do believe the problem is the compiler, It wouldn’t be compiling all your files. You can find an example of a compiler for a packaged source here.[/quote]Did you not see the difference in the Compiler and Run batch files? They go to different directories…
I’ve explained it before, but a compiler can take ONE java file, and compile an entire packaged server. It’s a chain reaction, whatever classes that the one java file calls are compiled, and then the classes that that one called are compiled, until all of the files that your server uses are compiled.

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:6, topic:355607”]As well as your compiler code. ;)[/quote]Why the compiler code? His compiler worked fine.

Kate, it’s an easy fix. You just need to change your Run.bat’s source directory to where your main class file is. So, like noobs said:[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:5, topic:355607”]show ur run[/quote]

item.title: HELP! All my CLASS files have changed to JAVA NOTEPAD files!
item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

[code]The compiler says:

Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. Press any key to continue... (I press any key to continue...)

I go to run the server. The server says:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: net/com/canownueas/Server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.com.canownueasy.Server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run<Unknown Source> at java.security.AccessController.doPriveledged<Native Method> at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unknown Source> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unknown Source> Could not find the main class: net/com/canownueasy/Server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue...

Help?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

Hi. Well I can’t run any server because it say’s it can’t find the main class Server file, but when I look at the file, the icon is like a little notepad page, and I look at the type, and It says JAVA. How can I get a server class file back? Or how can I make them into class files? Someone please help!
